page.title: 12DAVID LEWIS CENTRE cont.
page.content: Some stay at the centre all their lives, others go home for holidays eg. Christmas. Some live in hostel houses and are self sufficient. The residents are encouraged to be occupied and some have jobs outside but, with the current unemployment situation,this is becoming increasingly difficult. There is a clinical unit with a casualty service as the residents often fall over. There are dental and chiropody facilities. Some residents don't want to go on outings, but many go to such places as Chester Zoo and Alton Towers. They are also encouraged to have hobbies eg. model railways, billiards and sewing. Many residents have regular visitors and volunteers visit those who are forgotten by relatives.
